title: "Why do ADCs build Glass Cannon even when behind?"
body: I don't know, probably because every time an ADC builds an item that has HP on it, or any defensive item that isn't Maw/EoN, it gets nerfed into oblivion and made non-viable? Maybe, just maybe because Riot guts defensive items when an ADC looks at them funny, to the point where just building glass cannon into lifesteal gives a longer average survival time than building pure defense. Maybe that is why :^)

Honestly, the reason why ADC's get those items nerfed, (or nerfed for them) is they never seem to give up enough for those extra defenses. Realistically they should be forfeiting damage, since ADC's pretty much rely on stacking AD, AS, and Crit chance at the same time. Yet those items gave them enough damage while offering those tanky stats. 

Arguably because of their High DPS, their Tank(ish) option should be Life steal, even though it doesn't help much against burst. And people just complain about ADC's having no dueling power. But realistically, they need to forgo that power in exchange for the objective taking power, afforded to them for being the glass cannon.

Mainly because they provide nothing to their team if they don't deal damage (with a few odd exceptions like Ashe and co.)

The fundamental reason for picking an ADC is to deal damage, and if you aren't getting more damage, you fall further behind because an extra tiny bit of durability (unless it has damage attached to it like Merc scimitar) means nothing if you still can't kill the enemy before they kill you.

This has only become more of an issue recently because of damage creep, but ADCs are and should always be looking to get lucky kills in a fight to pull themselves back in, otherwise they are dead weight on their team.
